comments:
The operation to rename a Java Class ends up with an Internal Error with a long
stack frame and the class name change is not performed.

I have selected a class that is widely used throught the project. The project is
the Workflow demo used by the Red Book sg246302 related to "Eclipse Development:
using the Graphica Editing Framework and the Eclipse Modeling Framework"

After clicking the Preview> button the IDE start to process the changes ending
in an error condition with the next message:
Internal error while creating a change object. Consult log for detailed error
description.

These are some lines from the java stack frame on the error log:

Go on with your remarkable great job!!!

Created an attachment (id=18308)
The complete java stack trace for this error

Problem happened in org.eclipse.jst.jsp.core.internal.java.search.JSPSearchSupport.
Moving to Web Tools/jst.j2ee for comments.
David can you take a look?

This looks like the same problem from the newsgroups where there 
was incompatability with WTP M2 and Eclipse M3.

WTP M2 requires Eclipse >= M4 (for JSP component at least).

search for threads containing: "Updating JSP Index" on the eclipse.webtools
newsgroup for more details.
Changed Version field given new release numbering.
verifying as correctly handled as invalid due to install issues.
